# The German Alphabet - Part Two

Now we know about the German alphabet, it's time to continue learning about the rest 😃.

WARNING

Things here might seem too much for you, but you really don't have to worry about them too much now; after all, you gonna see these letters in words, and you'll learn how they're pronounced by time 😉.


  • Ä: This one sounds very much like the German e, which, in case you forget, pronounced like the فتحة in Arabic, or a soft a in English. Example: Spät means Late.

  • Ö: This one is over explained in many books I've read! to me, it sounds like a short hard o; just remember to round your lips while saying it 😮. Example: Öl means Oil.

  • Ü: Round your lips hard, but instead of saying long o, say long e, try it, it's funny 😄. Example: Über means Over | Tür means Door.

  • ß: That's just a double s combined together; pronounced as the English s. Example: Straße means Street.


That's it! Promise, no more letters 😄, that's all the German alphabet. Pat yourself on the back, feel accomplished, and see you in the next lesson 👋.
